item.title: 银行钟爱重大风险转移— 监管机构对此忧心忡忡
item.description: 银行一直处于困境之中。它们希望发放更多贷款，以便更好地与非银行贷款机构竞争并提高利润，但 2008 年金融危机后实施的更严格规定却阻碍了它们的发展，这些规定要求它们留出额外资金，以弥补已发放贷款的潜在损失。这就减少了可用于开展新贷款或扩大公司规模的新资金。【原文：Banks have been in a bind. They want to make more loans so they can better compete against non-banking lenders and boost profits, but they have been hindered by tighter rules imposed after the 2008 financial crisis that require them to hold aside extra money to cover potential losses on the loans they have already made. This leaves less fresh capital available to pursue new lending or expand the company.】
